intro: Scutellaria mulleri, commonly known as Chinese skullcap, is a flowering plant native to China and parts of Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces blue to violet flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Scutellaria mulleri is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits and is also cultivated for ornamental purposes.
